title: 115_s62
content: The Act may be cited as the "January 8th National Memorial Act" and includes findings. The tragedy of January 8, 2011, at Congresswoman Gabrielle Gifford's ``Congress on Your Corner'' event resulted in the deaths of 6 people and injury of 13 others. This was the first time in the history of the United States. The assassination attempt on Congresswoman Giffords during a meeting with constituents was the first in US history. Giffords sustained severe injuries, and staffer Gabe Zimmerman was assassinated. The Arizona community and people worldwide came together to support each other at memorial sites. The Tucson January 8th Memorial will honor the victims of the shooting at various vigil sites, including the shopping center, University Medical Center, and Congresswoman Giffords' district office. It will serve as a tribute to the local, national, and international response to the tragedy, providing a place for visitors to learn about the event. The Tucson January 8th Memorial will honor the victims of the shooting and showcase the resilience of the community and democracy in the United States. The Tucson January 8th Memorial will honor the victims of the shooting and showcase the resilience of the community and democracy in the United States. SEC. 3. JANUARY 8\TH\ NATIONAL MEMORIAL. The January 8th National Memorial, established by the Tucson's January 8th Memorial Foundation, is defined by key terms such as "Memorial", "Foundation", "Map", and "Secretary". The Secretary of the Interior shall establish the January 8th National Memorial as an affiliated area of the National Park System once the Foundation complies with requirements, including establishing a trust fund. The Foundation established a trust fund for receiving donations and managing the construction, operation, and maintenance of the Memorial. The Memorial will be managed by the Foundation and will consist of the area depicted as the "Memorial Boundary" on the map. The Memorial will cease to be part of the National Park System if the Foundation fails to manage it according to laws or stops maintaining the required trust fund. The map of the Memorial will be available for public inspection at National Park Service offices. The Secretary may enter into cooperative agreements. The Secretary may provide technical assistance and enter into cooperative agreements with the Foundation for financial assistance with marketing the Memorial. The Secretary is limited in acquiring property or using Federal funds for construction, operation, maintenance, or management of the Memorial. A general management plan will be developed by the Secretary in consultation with the Foundation. The Secretary, in consultation with the Foundation, will develop a general management plan for the Memorial in accordance with title 54, United States Code. The completed plan must be provided to the Committee on Natural Resources and the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources within 3 years of funds availability or Memorial establishment. The Secretary, in consultation with the Foundation, will develop a general management plan for the Memorial in accordance with title 54, United States Code. The completed plan must be provided to the Committee on Natural Resources and the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources within 3 years of funds availability or Memorial establishment. Representatives and the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources of the Senate.
